title: bzip2@1.0.6, two installations with same parameters but different hashes.
body:
I have compiled bzip2@1.0.6 and it seems that the package has somehow changed (after I have installed it). If I try to do the same installation now, then it will have a different hash, even though almost all parameters are equal in both installations.

There is a different order of the compiler flags, but I did not change them as spack takes them out of my compilers.yaml config file:

[spackapps@lo-login-02 bin]$ spack uninstall bzip2
==> Error: bzip2 matches multiple packages:

```
-- linux-centos7-x86_64 / gcc@4.8.5 -----------------------------
oricxs4 bzip2@1.0.6%gcc cflags="-ftree-vectorize -O2 -march=core-avx2 -fPIC -mavx2" cppflags="-ftree-vectorize -O2 -march=core-avx2 -fPIC -mavx2" cxxflags="-ftree-vectorize -O2 -march=core-avx2 -fPIC -mavx2" +shared

kxfalvt bzip2@1.0.6%gcc cflags="-march=core-avx2 -fPIC -ftree-vectorize -mavx2 -O2" cppflags="-march=core-avx2 -fPIC -ftree-vectorize -mavx2 -O2" cxxflags="-march=core-avx2 -fPIC -ftree-vectorize -mavx2 -O2" +shared
```

The installation with the hash starting with "oricxs4" is the older installation of both. Whenever I try to install another package depending on bzip2, spack refuses to use the installation with the oricxs4 hash and it tries to reinstall bzip2 giving it a new hash on every try:

```
[spackapps@lo-login-02 bin]$ spack install pbzip2@1.1.13 ^bzip2@1.0.6 %gcc@4.8.5 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64
==> Installing bzip2
==> Fetching http://www.bzip.org/1.0.6/bzip2-1.0.6.tar.gz
######################################################################## 100.0%
==> Staging archive: /cluster/apps/spack/var/spack/stage/bzip2-1.0.6-xfjc6b6uct7edobghiga5oe5rwoajth4/bzip2-1.0.6.tar.gz
==> Created stage in /cluster/apps/spack/var/spack/stage/bzip2-1.0.6-xfjc6b6uct7edobghiga5oe5rwoajth4

[spackapps@lo-login-02 bin]$ spack install pbzip2@1.1.13 ^bzip2@1.0.6 %gcc@4.8.5 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64
==> Installing bzip2
==> Fetching http://www.bzip.org/1.0.6/bzip2-1.0.6.tar.gz
######################################################################## 100.0%
==> Staging archive: /cluster/apps/spack/var/spack/stage/bzip2-1.0.6-j37ylfg7fjwa6kyaplclcekjndyaemfi/bzip2-1.0.6.tar.gz
==> Created stage in /cluster/apps/spack/var/spack/stage/bzip2-1.0.6-j37ylfg7fjwa6kyaplclcekjndyaemfi

[spackapps@lo-login-02 bin]$ spack install pbzip2@1.1.13 ^bzip2@1.0.6 %gcc@4.8.5 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64
==> Installing bzip2
==> Fetching http://www.bzip.org/1.0.6/bzip2-1.0.6.tar.gz
######################################################################## 100.0%
==> Staging archive: /cluster/apps/spack/var/spack/stage/bzip2-1.0.6-4m74wwinxix5sp7qdbbqnxbwxgc6afcu/bzip2-1.0.6.tar.gz
==> Created stage in /cluster/apps/spack/var/spack/stage/bzip2-1.0.6-4m74wwinxix5sp7qdbbqnxbwxgc6afcu

[spackapps@lo-login-02 bin]$ spack install pbzip2@1.1.13 ^bzip2@1.0.6 %gcc@4.8.5 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64
==> Installing bzip2
==> Fetching http://www.bzip.org/1.0.6/bzip2-1.0.6.tar.gz
######################################################################## 100.0%
==> Staging archive: /cluster/apps/spack/var/spack/stage/bzip2-1.0.6-wsezlyv2iwyfdjp5k6fvsuzruyho4fiz/bzip2-1.0.6.tar.gz
==> Created stage in /cluster/apps/spack/var/spack/stage/bzip2-1.0.6-wsezlyv2iwyfdjp5k6fvsuzruyho4fiz
```

First of all, shouldn't it be the same hash for all 4 installation attempts ? Because I don't see that there are any differences in the four bzip2 installation above. They use the same parameters, compiler flags etc.

Then I found #4610 where tgamblin proposes to use hashes to specify dependencies. But when trying to specify the existing bzip2 installation through its hash, I again got an error message:

```
[spackapps@lo-login-02 bin]$ spack install pbzip2@1.1.13 ^/oricxs4 %gcc@4.8.5 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64
==> Error: Attempting to concretize anonymous spec
[spackapps@lo-login-02 bin]$
```

I would prefer to not rebuild all packages depending on bzip2, because the package has changed. I have a working bzip2 installation that was installed through spack. Therefore it would be nice if specifying a dependency through its hash would work.
